definition: warp (the vertical threads in weaving)/vertical/longitudinal/north-south (lines of longitude)/lengthwise/to release/to indulge/even if

sentences.english: These lunches, though, are where the pampering begins and ends.
sentences.chinese: 這些午餐，雖然，是縱容開始和結束的地方。

sentences.english: However, I found that it just connived PTB.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我發現這樣恰恰縱容了PTB。

sentences.english: "I decided it was better for me to break that promise than to endorse the lie, " he says.
sentences.chinese: “我認爲寧肯我食言也不能縱容撒謊，”他說。

sentences.english: The Chinese government is deliberately or not condoned by the mob and prevent fragmentation mutilations?
sentences.chinese: 或者是中國政府故意不出來阻止而縱容暴徒虐殺不成？

sentences.english: " The wise man, humoring him, said, "Be a cutter.
sentences.chinese: 智者縱容着他說，“去做採石匠吧。”

sentences.english: He connived at letting the prisoner escape from prison.
The general is accused of conniving in a plot to topple the government.
sentences.chinese: 將軍被指控縱容一個顛覆政府的陰謀。

sentences.english: Society as a whole also connives in the denial.
sentences.chinese: 社會上普遍存在縱容剝奪權利的現象。

sentences.english: He indulges his son with plenty of pocket money.
sentences.chinese: 他縱容他的兒子，給他許多零用錢。

sentences.english: The Asians’ parsimony made the Anglo-Saxons’ profligacy possible.
sentences.chinese: 亞洲人的節儉縱容了歐美人的揮霍。

sentences.english: And Parents should tolerant such wrong behaviors, but not indulge them.
sentences.chinese: 父母對孩子犯錯應抱寬容的態度，但不能縱容。

sentences.english: Don't pamper damp scamp tramp s that camp under ramp lamps.
sentences.chinese: 不能縱容在斜坡燈下踐踏潮溼露營地的流氓。

sentences.english: Too low a credit-loss cost may connive "the spoilt children".
sentences.chinese: 失信成本過低會縱容“壞孩子”。

sentences.english: Instead of badgering him about why he's so busy, try pampering him a bit.
sentences.chinese: 與其和他爭吵爲什麼他怎麼忙，不如多縱容他一下。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, forgiving need not equal to conniving the mistake either.
sentences.chinese: 然而，原諒也並不等於縱容一個錯誤。

definition: to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
to feel grateful to sb/to appreciate the kindness
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
